snippet: The HBO comedy “Girls,” a cultural phenomenon in its first season, returns along with its less-than-sunny outlook on life.
abstract: Alessandra Stanley The TV Watch column argues that HBO series Girls, which is returning for its second season, is unique among comedy television series in that it doesn't provide a sunny outlook on human weaknesses or happy endings; says success of season two depends on how well show's creators can stay true to spirit of season one.
lead_paragraph: The HBO comedy “Girls,” a cultural phenomenon in its first season, returns along with its less-than-sunny outlook on life.

headline.main: The Edges Are Still Sharp in Brooklyn
headline.print_headline: The Edges Are Still Sharp In Brooklyn
